image.altText: Multiple officers dressed in hi-vis standing on a road at night time under a tent as the manhunt continues

props.synopsis: A massive search continues for a Porepunkah man who allegedly shot and killed two police officers at his property in rural Victoria. Follow live.

title.children: Porepunkah residents remain in lockdown as search for alleged gunman continues

image.altText: A man wearing glasses low on his nose, with a placard reading Iran in front of him

props.synopsis: An Israeli government spokesperson has effectively accused Australia of being shamed into acting against Iran in the wake of revelations it was involved in antisemitic attacks.

title.children: Iran slams 'weak' Albanese as Israel claims credit for ambassador ban

image.altText: A house with a sign out front reading the Embassy of the Islamic Republic of Iran with the country's flag on a pole

props.synopsis: While attacks on Jews in places like Australia reinforce the narrative of Israel's right wing, certain elements within Iran see them as part of a strategy to threaten Israel and inflate Iran's power beyond its limited military and diplomatic range.

title.children: Iran's alleged antisemitic attacks in Australia may be 'power projection'

image.altText: A screengrab from CCTV of a road with a car and people standing at the entrance of a building

props.synopsis: Iran orchestrated at least two antisemitic attacks in Australia, according to Australia’s national security service ASIO. Here's what we know.

title.children: Here's what we know about Iran's involvement in Australian attacks

image.altText: Tony Burke in front of flags.

props.synopsis: Australia is currently seeking to resettle three people released as a result of the landmark "NZYQ" High Court decision on the tiny island nation in exchange for an undisclosed fee, but their removal has been stalled since February due to court challenges.

title.children: Government moves to bolster powers to deport non-citizens to Nauru

image.altText: A man in a black shirt holds a woman wearing a black and white dress in a warm embrace in a flower-filled garden

props.synopsis: The superstar couple revealed the news in a joint post on Instagram.

title.children: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce announce engagement

image.altText: A high shot of Linda Reynolds in a media scrum answering questions outside the WA Supreme Court in Perth.

props.synopsis: The outcome of one of Australia's highest-profile defamation cases will be known today when WA Supreme Court Justice Paul Tottle rules on whether or not former senator Linda Reynolds was defamed by her former staffer Brittany Higgins.

title.children: The Reynolds vs Higgins judgement is today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A picture of a camera and backpack on stairs next a persons legs covered in dust an rubble

props.synopsis: The IDF report into the strikes which killed 20 people, among them five journalists, says troops targeted a camera set up by Hamas but doesn't provide evidence for that claim.

title.children: Israel's Gaza hospital strike inquiry fails to acknowledge second attack

image.altText: A close-up of Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The prime minister has confirmed Australia was "primarily" responsible for the investigation that found Iran directed antisemitic attacks in Sydney and Melbourne.

title.children: Iran labels Australia's expulsion of ambassador an 'assault on diplomacy'

image.altText: Two men at a podium in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: Australia's actions in revealing Iran's activities may result in the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps turning its attention to new targets.

title.children: With Iran exposed, the regime could now turn its attention to new targets

image.altText: A teenage boys with glasses puts on a face mask out in a garden

props.synopsis: Five months after the algal bloom was first detected on the Fleurieu Peninsula, residents along parts of the SA coast say it is continuing to impact their physical and mental health, with a new survey revealing feelings of worry and anxiety.

title.children: Along SA's coastal frontline, the algal bloom is continuing to impact residents

image.altText: A logo of small black e in the middle of white star, green circles surround it, with different symbols, including a question.

props.synopsis: The telco's customers reported losses of at least $412,000 after scammers repeatedly breached its verification processes.

title.children: Telco Exetel fined $694K for anti-scam breaches

image.altText: Rangers and police surround a tent

props.synopsis: City of Moreton Bay council says it has spent $1.4 million enforcing homelessness policies after making homeless camping illegal in March.

title.children: Council spends more than $1m on 'illegal' homeless camps crackdown

image.altText: A man sits on the steps leading to his front door, posing for a photo, holding a photograph

props.synopsis: Family members who have found out specimens from their loved ones' bodies had been retained by a pathology museum without consent are waiting for the coroner's investigation to finish before they decide what their next steps will be.

title.children: Legal action 'an option' over body parts collected without consent

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: Beau Lamarre-Condon has been in custody since last February, when he was arrested after attending a Bondi police station following the disappearance of Jesse Baird and Luke Davies.

title.children: Former police officer pleads not guilty to murdering Sydney couple

image.altText: Large flames engulf a building at night.

props.synopsis: Fire crews were unable to save the building despite an hours-long effort to stop the blaze, which is believed to have started in a container trailer.

title.children: 'People are stunned': Marshall Islands parliament destroyed by fire

image.altText: A lady's hands shown close up holding a letter from Aus Super

props.synopsis: At least 6.5 million Australians will have no say in who inherits their superannuation, according to new research from Super Consumers Australia. It is urging people to make sure they have a legally "binding" nomination to ensure their super goes to the people they want it to.

title.children: Millions of Australians will not have a say in who inherits their superannuation

image.altText: A man with a navy shirt stands in an elevator with his back to the camera. A mirror reflects his face showing he has glasses.

props.synopsis: David McWilliams took millions of dollars from investors by saying he was building houses for people with profound disabilities. Despite having his assets frozen, Four Corners can reveal he is still living a lavish lifestyle.

title.children: He's at the centre of a major fraud investigation. We tracked him down in an elevator

image.altText: a woman with braids looking at papers

props.synopsis: Experts say accessing compensation when things go wrong with a home build or renovation an be a costly, unfair and time-consuming business.

title.children: Even a tribunal win didn't get Maria's money back after losing $45k to a builder

image.altText: An anonymized photo of a woman - the back of her head, her staring out a window from a tall viewpoint.

props.synopsis: Three years and over $300,000 later, Alessia's experience in the Sydney registry of the Family Court has left her emotionally and financially depleted.

title.children: 'Bleeding money': After years in Family Court, Alessia dreads the final bill

image.altText: A close shot of Ley speaking.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley has played down tensions within the Coalition over its position on net zero, after a reportedly chaotic partyroom meeting where a number of MPs argued over the Coalition's climate position.

title.children: Sussan Ley plays down argument over net zero at Coalition partyroom meeting

image.altText: Will sitting at a coffee shop with a pot of tea in front of him.

props.synopsis: A delinquent teenager has been ordered to serve more than seven years behind bars for killing a man in a high-speed crash in Melbourne's south-east last year.

title.children: Teenage driver cries as judge jails him over deadly, high-speed crash

image.altText: A man wearing a tie, holding hands with his wife as they walk out of court.

props.synopsis: Jurors in Matt Wright's criminal trial have been warned not to get caught up in the emotion of the tragic fatal accident, or be swayed by the "saturation" of media coverage on the case.

title.children: Injured pilot endured 'massive credit attack' from Matt Wright's lawyers, court hears

image.altText: Students from the NCP in Bangladesh.

props.synopsis: Bangladesh's student uprising forced their prime minister to flee. Now they're trying to become a force for change from within the political system.

title.children: University students overthrew their country's dictator. Now comes the hard part

image.altText: A 3D sign reading "Australian National University" with a purple sky in the background.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University responds to concerns raised by Australia's higher education regulator after it demanded the university defend the conduct of its council members, while admitting there's "much work to do".

title.children: ANU admits 'much work to do' while defending leadership, financial position

image.altText: Two small boats with people in uniform in the foreground and a large ship with a crane on it in the background.

props.synopsis: Captain Danniel Lyon, Lieutenant Maxwell Nugent, Warrant Officer Class 2 Joseph "Phillip" Laycock and Corporal Alexander Naggs died in the 2023 Taipan crash.

title.children: Senate to vote on whether to make fatal Taipan helicopter crash documents public

image.altText: Nathan Cleary in a warm up,. with his arms stretched in front of him, preparing to catch a ball

props.synopsis: Panthers coach Ivan Cleary is backing his side to become the first team to win an NRL premiership after finishing outside the top four following the home and away season.

title.children: Panthers rest 16 stars for Bulldogs clash as Cleary pulls plug on top four shot

image.altText: A blonde man and a brunette man smile for a picture

props.synopsis: Former grand prix champions Sergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas are confirmed as the debut lineup for Formula 1's new team, Cadillac.

title.children: Sergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas to return to F1 with Cadillac

image.altText: Laura Pettenuzzo sits in a wheelchair, smiling, with a coffee in a cup holder

props.synopsis: Laura's struggles as a teenager were helped by friendships forged online. She wonders how things would have looked if a social media ban existed then.

title.children: 'I was lucky': How social media helped me find community in my teens

image.altText: Trump makes an announcement on 2026 FIFA World Cup

props.synopsis: When Jerome Powell let slip that US monetary policy was restricting the economy, Donald Trump unleashed a wave of buying on both stock and debt markets.

title.children: How China is outmanoeuvring Trump on tariffs

image.altText: Lisa Cook speaking in court

props.synopsis: US Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook is refusing to stand down after President Donald Trump said he was firing her.

title.children: US Federal Reserve governor refuses to stand down after Trump 'firing'

image.altText: A concept drawing of the chocolate experience showing a large chocolate fountain.

props.synopsis: The dream of the "world's largest chocolate fountain" promised by the Tasmanian Liberal government in March last year has melted away from a project given $12 million in taxpayer funds.

title.children: 'World's largest chocolate fountain' dropped from developer plans at Cadbury
